      • PVector

        public PVector(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> coordinates)
        Creates a PerceptronVector. A copy of the input list is made.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - the coordinates of the vector as an ArrayList

        Returns:

      • listOf

        public static java.util.List<PVector> listOf(java.lang.Integer[]... coord)
        Creates a list of PVectors with the given coordinates.

        Sample usage with output [(1,0), (0,1), (1,1), (0,0)] : 

         Integer[][] coordinates= { {1,0}, {0,1}, {1,1}, {0,0}};
 List<PVector> list = PVector.of(coordinates);
 System.err.println(list);
        Parameters:
        coord - the coordinates of the vector.
        Returns:

      • constant

        public static PVector constant(int n,
                               java.lang.Integer value)
        Returns a vector of given size and with all coordinates equal to value.
        Parameters:
        n - size
        value - constant value
        Returns:
        PVector of size n, with all coordinates equal to value
